title: General
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

1 point - for citing the appropriate Latin.

1 point - for giving an accurate translation. Any of the following answers are possible:

sola (ne): alone

maerens: grieving, unhappy

carpere: will you be consumed (consume yourself)?

[Translation must reflect the correct person and tense; no translation point if rendered as an infinitive.]

Any combination of the various elements in line 2 is acceptable, but perpetua iuventa by itself would not qualify as a consequence.

nec dulces natos.....noris?: will you not know sweet children?

Veneris nec praemia noris?: will you not know the rewards of love?

N.B. The verb noris need not appear in the answer.
